dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ramallocation

Class PBRAMAllocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ramallocation.PBRAMAllocator

  • public class PBRAMAllocator
extends java.lang.Object
    The PBRAMAllocator is a utility class for the C Data Structure (CDS) generator. It calculates the indexes for allocated objects and assigns them to given PrimitiveType that then can be used as reference to the object in RAM.

    After creating an instance of PBRAMAllocator you can allocate space for arbitrary CType objects using method alloc(CTypeDescriptors, CType, PrimitiveType) respective alloc(int, int, PrimitiveType). The alloc methods only check the given arguments and saves them but doesn't calculate indexes or change values in the reference objects. How much space has been allocated so far can be requested by calling method getAllocatedSpace().

    After allocating space for all objects it is necessary to call method process() in order to sort the allocated objects by their alignment requirements and assign the calculated indexes to the saved reference objects. The index starts with zero by default. You can change this value with method setStartIndex(int) (before calling method process()!).

    Example: 

     CTypeDescriptors descriptors = new CTypeDescriptors();
 // maybe change default descriptors and add descriptors for own types

 UInt16 myRef1 = new UInt16("myRef1", 0);
 UInt16 myRef2 = new UInt16("myRef2", 0);
 UInt16 myRef3 = new UInt16("myRef3", 0);

 PBRAMAllocator allocator = new PBRAMAllocator();
 allocator.alloc(descriptors, new UInt8(0), myRef1);
 allocator.alloc(descriptors, new UInt32(0), myRef2);
 allocator.alloc(descriptors,
                 new Array<SInt16>(new SInt16[]{new SInt16(1), new SInt16(2), new SInt16(3)}),
                 myRef3);

 allocator.setStartIndex(128);
 allocator.process();

    After calling method process() in the example above the allocated memory is sorted by the alignment requirements in descending order. UInt32 has the highest alignment requirement 4 and a size of 4, so myRef2 now has the value 128 (the given start index). UInt16 has alignment requirement 2 and the array has a size of 6, so myRef3 now shows 132. SInt8 has the lowest alignment reqirement 1 and a size of 1, so myRef1 now shows 138.

    Since:
    2008.b

    • Method Detail

      • alloc

        public int alloc(CTypeDescriptors descriptors,
                 CType obj,
                 PrimitiveType reference)
        Allocates space for the given CType object according to the size and alignment requirements specified in the relevant descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptors - A valid CTypeDescriptors instance to determine the size and alignment requirements of the given CType object, never null.
        obj - The CType instance to allocate space for, never null.
        reference - A PrimitiveType instance whose value will be set to the index of the allocated memory when calling method process(), never null.
        Returns:
        The sum of allocated space in bytes so far.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • alloc

        public int alloc(int size,
                 int alignment,
                 PrimitiveType reference)
        Allocates space for an object with the given size and alignment requirements.
        Parameters:
        size - The size in bytes to allocate, e.g. the result of CTypeDescriptors.sizeof(Class). The value is the minimum size to allocate. If it's not a multiple of the given alignment then the allocated size will be increased to the next valid value. The minimum value is 1.
        alignment - The alignment requirements, e.g. the result of CTypeDescriptors.getAlignment(Class). The minimum value is 1.
        reference - A PrimitiveType instance whose value will be set to the index of the allocated memory when calling method process(), never null.
        Returns:
        The sum of allocated space in bytes so far.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getAllocatedSpace

        public int getAllocatedSpace()
        Returns the size in bytes that has been allocated so far.
        Returns:
        The sum of allocated space in bytes so far.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getStartIndex

        public int getStartIndex()
        Returns:
        The memory index to start allocation.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • setStartIndex

        public void setStartIndex(int startIndex)
        Sets the memory index to start allocation.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - A new index, can't be negative.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • process

        public int process()
        Sorts the allocated memory from the biggest to the smallest alignment and assigns the start indexes to the relevant references. This method should be called only once after the memory for all objects has been allocated.
        Returns:
        The next free memory index.
        Since:
        2008.b
